intro: Otopappus tequilanus, commonly known as the Tequila dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Otopappus tequilanus is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous communities for various health purposes.
